t: Proverbs 5
Warning Against Adultery
My*pn son, pay attention to my wisdom, turn*ld your ear to my words of insight,
that*ln you may maintain discretion and*ld your lips may preserve knowledge.
For*ln the lips of the adulterous woman drip honey, and*ld her speech is smoother than oil;
but*ln in the end she is bitter as gall, sharp*ld as a double-edged sword.
Her*ln feet go down to death; her*ld steps lead straight to the grave.
She*ln gives no thought to the way of life; her*ld paths wander aimlessly, but she does not know it.
Now*pn then, my sons, listen to me; do*ld not turn aside from what I say.
Keep*ln to a path far from her, do*ld not go near the door of her house,
lest*ln you lose your honor to others and*ld your dignity to one who is cruel,
lest*ln strangers feast on your wealth and*ld your toil enrich the house of another.
At*ln the end of your life you will groan, when*ld your flesh and body are spent.
You*ln will say, “How I hated discipline! How*ld my heart spurned correction!
I*ln would not obey my teachers or*ld turn my ear to my instructors.
And*ln I was soon in serious trouble in*ld the assembly of God’s people.”
Drink*pn water from your own cistern, running*ld water from your own well.
Should*ln your springs overflow in the streets, your*ld streams of water in the public squares?
Let*ln them be yours alone, never*ld to be shared with strangers.
May*ln your fountain be blessed, and*ld may you rejoice in the wife of your youth.
A*ln loving doe, a graceful deer— may*ld her breasts satisfy you always, may*ld you ever be intoxicated with her love.
Why,*ln my son, be intoxicated with another man’s wife? Why*ld embrace the bosom of a wayward woman?
For*pn your ways are in full view of the Lord,*s and*ld he examines all your paths.
The*ln evil deeds of the wicked ensnare them; the*ld cords of their sins hold them fast.
For*ln lack of discipline they will die, led*ld astray by their own great folly.
